Enable Emojis in Quarto

Quarto
Published

August 23, 2021

On this page

  • 1. Visual Editor
  • 2. Include 'from: markdown+emoji' in Header

This post explains two ways to insert emojis into a quarto blog.1

1. Visual Editor

One way to add emojis to a quarto blog posts is from the ‚ÄòVisual‚Äô editor in R Studio, select the Insert tab \(\rightarrow\) ‚ÄòSpecial Characters‚Äô \(\rightarrow\) ‚ÄòInsert Emoji ‚Ä¶‚Äô and then selecting you desired emoji from a large list.

2. Include 'from: markdown+emoji' in Header

The second way to add emoji‚Äôs into a quarto blog is to include ‚Äòfrom: markdown+emoji‚Äô in the .qmd header, and then type the name of the emoji you want to include encased in colons as shown below:

:grinning: \(\rightarrow\) üòÄ

:smile: \(\rightarrow\) üòÑ

:heart: \(\rightarrow\) ‚ù§Ô∏è

:thumbsup: \(\rightarrow\) üëç

:call_me_hand: \(\rightarrow\) ü§ô
